channel.title: My First Website
channel.description: Recent content on My First Website

item.title: My First Shiny App Details
item.description: I have deployed my first shiny app when I was working on the Problem Set # 3 This was a challenging yet rewarding assignment where we were given clear instructions and chunks of code In order to complete this assignment, one has to understand the concept of reactivity and how to render reactive data elements. Below is the final code that I have deployed and feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello, I am Ravi Duvvuri, a data savy IT professional who is ambitious and getting back to school after almost 10 years to pursue Masters in Data Science program. In my IT career so far, I have implemented couple of Enterprise Dataware Solutions in different capacities that include Requirement Gathering, Architecture, Design, Development and Testing. Business Intelligence, ETL Development and SQL are my strong areas technically and my communication skills combined with analytical skills help me thrive in customer facing discussions.

item.title: My First Blog
item.description: Spring 2019: DSBA5122 (May 1st 2019) Visual Analytics is my first course in the DSBA program. The course website was built by Andrew Heiss and the content is managed by Prof.Ryan. Course schedule is very well laid out and it was upto date with the Readings, Assignments and Class material. Datacamp courses are designed in such a way that even a student with no background of R can follow these courses and get upto speed.
